results.title: Relax it's just sex [DVD]
results.creator_credit: P.J. Castellaneta, Harold Warren, Megan O'Neill, Steven J Wolfe, Sneak Preview Entertainment, Forefront Films and Millivres Multimedia
results.brief_description: Relax its just sex is about a group of twenty/thirty-something friends - a mix of straight, lesbian, bi-sexual and homosexual - sorting through the complexities of their relationships with various lovers and friends. Tara (Jennifer Tilly) is the mother hen of the group who keeps them all together; Vincey is the only single one and longs for a partner; Sarina and Megan break up when Megan sleeps with a man; Robin is their friend who helps Sarina out. On the whole the film has a comic tone - the opening sequence cautions the audience that when it comes to homosexuality there is nothing to be afraid of. Nevertheless, the film soon turns tragic as it delves into issues such as AIDS and gay bashing. Characters frequently address the camera, explaining their inner thoughts and feelings about their current situation as well as musing on the nature of love and sex. With at least ten principal characters, some are not given enough screen time to develop beyond caricature and at times the film is stagnated by its talkiness. Despite these flaws however, “Relax its just sex” is by turns amusing, thought provoking and quite sexy.

results.title: Relativistic time dilation
results.creator_credit: Paul Hewitt and Kinetic Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: An animated treatment of time dilation that utilises a flash counting sequence to show the unambiguous aging of twins in different frames of reference. Using only Einstein’s postulates, but without using a single mathematical equation, the results are the same as those using the equations for the relativistic Doppler shift and the Einstein-Lorentz time dilation. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Relatives (AFC)
results.creator_credit: Antony J. Bowman, Basil Appleby, Henri Safran, Quantum Films and Archer Films
results.brief_description: Set in beautiful cattle farming country New South Wales during the 1980s, this quirky comedy drama centres around a family reunion to celebrate grandfather’s 80th birthday. Spanning three generations, the relatives all gather at the historical family homestead, some from the city and others from the country. Add to this an intruder from Czechoslovakia, lots of alcohol, family jealousies and rivalries, “dangerous” liaisons, a somewhat bewildered and bemused grandfather, and an important announcement which will affect the whole family, there can be only one outcome - disaster. Cast includes Bill Kerr, Rowena Wallace, Carol Raye, Ray Barrett and Norman Kaye. Music written and played by Norman Kaye and photography by Tom Cowan.

results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description:
Simon thought he knew his parents… A film about a family, a deception and its legacy.
The visual effects in this film were all camera-created, using a technique of projection onto a moving sheet to create the insubstantial and constantly changing images that reflect the perceptions of the narrator (Simon Cooper). Nothing in his world turned out to be what it first seemed.

results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description: Family ties are often a fragile thing, as Simon is about to discover as he unravels the secrets of one man’s childhood. A haunting look at the issues facing modern family life.

results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description: A beautiful mediation on the meaning of family and blood ties. Photographs and home movies of the past form the extent of one man’s childhood memory of his father. In attempting to recover his past, he discovers that time’s absences and betrayals are apt to be repeated.

results.title: Relationships and stress (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper, Time-Life Video & Television and Tapper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
One part of a series of six programs which looks at the major problems faced by Joan Robinson, who is dying of cancer. This episode shows ways of handling the changing relationships with family, friends and medical personnel. Experts talk to the viewer about how serious illness can materially change relationships and how people can cope with the emotions and strains that inevitably follow diagnosis of a serious illness. Narrated by Meryl Streep.

results.title: Relationships
results.brief_description: Starting, ending and maintaining relationships is never easy. Peter Quarry leads couples through the minefield and discusses: What attracts people to each other, how to turn a friendship into something deeper, how to keep a relationship alive, conflict, resolution, knowing when to quit, being single and enjoying it.
